title: Wrong optimization

body:
<!--
Thank you for filing a bug report! 🐛 Please provide a short summary of the bug,
along with any information you feel relevant to replicating the bug.
-->

I tried this code:

```rust
fn max_turbulence_size(arr: Vec<i32>) -> i32 {
    let mut prev = 0;
    let mut cnt = 0;
    let mut ret = 0;
    for w in arr.windows(2) {
        let d = w[1] - w[0];
        if d == 0 {
            cnt = 0;
        } else if d > 0 {
            if prev < 0 {
                cnt += 1;
            } else {
                cnt = 1;
            }
        } else {
            if prev > 0 {
                cnt += 1;
            } else {
                cnt = 1;
            }
        }
        // Uncomment the follow line will give the right answer
        // println!("{} {}", d, prev);
        ret = ret.max(cnt);
        // The follow line seems optimized out if we don't access `prev`, `d` simultaneously.
        prev = d;
    }
    ret + 1
}

fn main() {
    let v = vec![9,4,2,10,7,8,8,1,9];
    let ans = max_turbulence_size(v);
    // The right answer is 5. But when build with release, the output is 2
    println!("{}", ans);
}
```

I expected to see this happen: 5 is printed.

Instead, this happened: when build with release, the output is 2.

### Meta
<!--

bug also exists in the beta or nightly versions.

`rustc --version --verbose`:

```
LLVM version: 13.0.0
```

I also test all the following rust version at [playground](https://play.rust-lang.org/?version=stable&mode=release&edition=2021&gist=7caf4bed4464c48f38586228fa378cc9), and got wrong answer when build with release.

beta: 1.62.0-beta.6
nightly: 1.64.0-nightly (2022-06-25 20a6f3a8a8ce5ae18d06)
